question: Who became the second Indian to travel to space and the first to visit the International Space Station (ISS) as part of Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4) in 2025?
solution:
• Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla became the second Indian to travel to spaceafter Rakesh Sharma (1984) and the first Indian to visit the ISS.
  • He was selected from ISRO’s Gaganyaan astronaut pool and served as the mission pilot aboard SpaceX’s Dragon capsule “Grace”.
  • The mission lasted 18 days and involved seven India-specific experiments in microgravity, contributing to India’s upcoming Gaganyaan human spaceflight program.
  • The Ax-4 mission was a collaboration between Axiom Space, NASA, ISRO, and ESA, and marked a historic milestone for India, Poland, and Hungary.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other dignitaries celebrated his return, calling it a golden chapter in India’s space odyssey.

question: Which satellite was launched by ISRO on 17 February 2025 using GSLV-F14 for advanced meteorological observations and disaster alerts?
solution:
• INSAT-3DS was launched by ISRO on 17 February 2025 aboard the GSLV-F14 rocket from Sriharikota.
  • It is an advanced meteorological satellite designed to enhance weather forecasting, climate monitoring, and disaster alert systems.
  • The mission is fully funded by the Ministry of Earth Sciences (MoES) and supports continuity of services from INSAT-3D and INSAT-3DR.
  • It carries state-of-the-art payloads including a 6-channel Imager, 19-channel Sounder, Data Relay Transponder (DRT), and Satellite Aided Search & Rescue (SAS&R).
  • The satellite aids in monitoring land and ocean surfaces, atmospheric conditions, and supports real-time disaster response and early warning systems.
  • Indian industries played a significant role in its development, showcasing Make in India in space technology.

question: Which lunar mission launched by ISRO on 14 July 2023 aimed to map the location and abundance of lunar water without an orbiter?
solution:
• Chandrayaan-3 was launched by ISRO on 14 July 2023 using the LVM3-M4 rocket from Sriharikota.
  • It was a follow-on mission to Chandrayaan-2, designed to demonstrate safe landing and surface operations on the Moon’s south pole.
  • Unlike its predecessor, Chandrayaan-3 did not carry an orbiter; it consisted of a Vikram lander and Pragyan rover.
  • The mission’s main scientific objective was to map the location and abundance of lunar water, especially in high-latitude polar regions.
  • The ChaSTE instrument aboard Vikram provided first-ever in-situ temperature profiles, helping identify potential water ice deposits.
  • The findings revealed that poleward slopes with angles above 14° may support stable subsurface water ice, crucial for future lunar habitation and ISRU (In-Situ Resource Utilization).
  • Chandrayaan-3 marked India’s first successful soft landing on the Moon, making it the first country to land near the lunar south pole.

question: Aditya-L1, launched by ISRO on 2 September 2023 using PSLV C57, studies:
option_3: Solar corona and chromosphere
solution:
Aditya-L1 is India’s first dedicated solar observatory mission, launched by ISRO on 2 September 2023 using the PSLV-C57 rocket from Sriharikota.
  • It is positioned in a halo orbit around the Sun–Earth Lagrange Point 1 (L1), about 5 million km from Earth, allowing continuous observation of the Sun without eclipses.
  • The mission aims to study the solar corona, chromosphere, and solar wind, and understand coronal heating, solar flares, and space weather phenomena.
  • It carries seven scientific payloads, including:
    • VELC (Visible Emission Line Coronagraph) – for imaging and spectroscopy of the solar corona.
    • SUIT (Solar Ultraviolet Imaging Telescope) – for observing the chromosphere and photosphere in near-UV.
  • These instruments help investigate coronal mass ejections (CMEs), solar magnetic fields, and solar irradiance variations, crucial for predicting space weather and protecting satellites.
  • Aditya-L1 places India among elite solar research nations, alongside NASA and ESA.

question: Which mission marked the first commercial launch of ISRO’s LVM3 rocket, deploying 36 satellites in October 2022?
solution:
• OneWeb India-1 was launched on 23 October 2022 using LVM3-M2 from Sriharikota.
  • It was the first commercial mission of LVM3 (formerly GSLV Mk III).
  • A total of 36 OneWeb Gen-1 satellites were deployed into Low Earth Orbit (LEO).
  • The mission was executed by NewSpace India Limited (NSIL) for OneWeb, a UK-based satellite communications company backed by Bharti Global.
  • This launch marked India’s entry into the global commercial satellite launch market with heavy payload capability.

question: Which ISRO mission launched in June 2022 using PSLV-C53 carried three Singaporean satellites and hosted payloads from two Indian start-ups?
solution:
• DS-EO Mission was launched on 30 June 2022 using PSLV-C53 from Sriharikota.
  • It was the second dedicated commercial mission of NSIL (NewSpace India Limited).
  • Carried three satellites from Singapore:
    • DS-EO (Electro-Optic, multi-spectral imaging)
    • NeuSAR (Singapore’s first SAR payload satellite)
    • SCOOB-1 (student satellite from NTU)
  • Hosted six payloads on the PSLV Orbital Experimental Module (POEM), including those from Indian start-ups:
    • Digantara – ROBI (space radiation monitoring)
    • Dhruva Space – DSOD-1U satellite deployer
  • POEM used the spent PS4 stage as a stabilized platform for in-orbit experiments—first time ever by ISRO.

question: Which Indian satellite, launched in August 2021 using GSLV-F10, failed due to a cryogenic stage malfunction?
solution:
• EOS-03, launched on 12 August 2021 via GSLV-F10, was India’s first agile Earth observation satellite intended for real-time imaging of large areas.
  • The mission failed due to an anomaly in the Cryogenic Upper Stage (CUS)—specifically, a leak in the Vent & Relief Valve (VRV) caused low LH2 tank pressure, leading to Fuel Booster Turbo Pump malfunction.
  • The satellite was meant to monitor natural disasters, water bodies, vegetation, and forest cover.

question: Which satellite, launched by ISRO in February 2021 using PSLV-C51, was Brazil’s first Earth observation satellite?
solution:
• Amazonia-01 was launched on 28 February 2021 via PSLV-C51 from Sriharikota.
  • It was the first Earth observation satellite developed by Brazil, built by INPE (National Institute for Space Research).
  • The satellite monitors deforestation in the Amazon region and supports agricultural analysis across Brazil.
  • The mission also carried 18 co-passenger satellites from India and the USA.

question: Which ISRO mission, scheduled for late 2025, will be the first unmanned flight test before India’s inaugural human spaceflight?
solution:
• Gaganyaan-1 is planned for Q4 2025 as the first uncrewed test flight of India’s human spaceflight programme.
  • It will validate systems like the crew module, escape system, and life support.
  • The flight will carry Vyommitra, a humanoid robot, and scientific payloads.
  • It precedes two more test flights before the crewed Gaganyaan mission, expected in 2027.

question: Which satellite, jointly developed by NASA and ISRO and scheduled for launch in July 2025, is the world’s first dual-band radar imaging mission?
solution:
• NISAR (NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar) is set to launch on 30 July 2025 aboard GSLV-F16 from Sriharikota.
  • It is the first Earth observation satellite to use dual-frequency SAR:
    • L-band radar (by NASA) for deep vegetation and crustal movement.
    • S-band radar (by ISRO) for surface-level changes.
  • Positioned in a sun-synchronous orbit (747 km), it will provide high-resolution, all-weather, day-night imaging every 12 days.
  • Applications include:
    • Disaster monitoring (earthquakes, floods, landslides)
    • Climate tracking (glacial melt, sea-level rise)
    • Agriculture & urban planning (crop health, land subsidence)
  • Data will be freely available within 1–2 days, and in real-time during emergencies.

question: Which upcoming ISRO mission, scheduled for launch in March 2028, aims to study the surface and atmosphere of Venus?
solution:
• Shukrayaan-1, also referred to as the Venus Orbiter Mission, is India’s first planned interplanetary mission to Venus.
  • Launch Date: 29 March 2028 using LVM3 from Sriharikota.
  • It will investigate:
    • Venus’s atmospheric chemistry and dynamics
    • Surface geology and mineralogy
    • Interaction of solar wind with the ionosphere
  • Expected to enter Venus orbit on 19 July 2028, after a 112-day journey.

question: Which ISRO mission, scheduled for 2025, will be the second unmanned flight test under India’s human spaceflight programme?
solution:
• Gaganyaan-2 is the second uncrewed test flight planned under ISRO’s Gaganyaan programme, scheduled for 2025.
  • It follows Gaganyaan-1, and will further validate systems like crew module re-entry, life support, and orbital operations.
  • These unmanned missions are precursors to India’s first crewed spaceflight, expected in 2027.
  • The mission may also carry Vyommitra, a humanoid robot, to simulate crew conditions.

question: Which is the expected launch year of Gaganyaan-3, the first crewed mission under India’s human spaceflight programme?
solution:
• Gaganyaan-3 is planned as India’s first crewed spaceflight, under ISRO’s Gaganyaan programme.
  • It is expected to launch in 2026, carrying three astronauts to Low Earth Orbit (LEO) for a 3-day mission.
  • The mission will validate life support systems, orbital module operations, and safe re-entry.
  • It follows two uncrewed test flights—Gaganyaan-1 and Gaganyaan-2—scheduled for 2025.

question: Which organization is jointly conducting the Lunar Polar Exploration Mission (LUPEX), scheduled for launch in 2028–29 to explore the Moon’s south pole region?
solution:
• The Lunar Polar Exploration Mission (LUPEX) is a joint mission by ISRO (India) and JAXA (Japan).
  • It aims to explore the permanently shadowed regions of the Moon’s south pole, focusing on water ice detection and surface mobility technologies.
  • ISRO will provide the lander, while JAXA will supply the rover and launch vehicle (H3).
  • The mission will carry instruments from NASA, ESA, and other collaborators for in-situ resource analysis.
  • LUPEX is expected to launch no earlier than 2028, with a six-month surface operation planned.

question: Which upcoming ISRO mission, expected to launch in 2028, will include an orbiter, lander, and rover to study the Martian surface and atmosphere?
solution:
• Mangalyaan-2, also known as the Mars Lander Mission (MLM), is ISRO’s second interplanetary mission to Mars, following the success of Mangalyaan-1 in 2013.
  • Unlike its predecessor, Mangalyaan-2 will include an orbiter, lander, and rover, and may also feature a Mars helicopter for aerial surveys.
  • The mission aims to study:
    • Martian surface geology and mineralogy
    • Atmospheric composition and dynamics
    • Dust rings from Mars’ moons (Phobos and Deimos)
  • It will carry advanced payloads like MODEX, ARIS, LPEX, and hyperspectral cameras for in-situ analysis.

question: Which planned ISRO mission, expected to launch in 2028, aims to collect and return lunar samples to Earth?
solution:
• Chandrayaan-4 is India’s first lunar sample-return mission, scheduled for launch in 2028 using two LVM3 rockets.
  • The mission will include five modules: lander, ascender, transfer module, re-entry module, and propulsion module.
  • A robotic arm will collect samples from the Moon’s south pole region, which will be transferred to the ascender, then docked with the re-entry module in lunar orbit for return to Earth.
  • This mission will demonstrate orbital docking, sample containerization, and Earth re-entry technologies, paving the way for future crewed lunar missions.

question: What is the name of the planned modular space station that ISRO aims to make fully operational between 2028 and 2035?
solution:
• The Bharatiya Antariksha Station (BAS) is ISRO’s proposed indigenous space station project.
  • First module (BAS-1) to launch in 2028, full capability by 2035.
  • Will support long-duration human space missions, including research and tech demonstration.
  • Features include:
  • Modular design with five key segments (core, science, lab, base, common unit)
  • Orbiting at 400–450 km, housing 3–6 astronauts
  • Part of India’s Space Vision 2047, aiming for a crewed lunar mission by 2040

question: Which ISRO mission, launched in June 2022 using PSLV-C53, carried three Singaporean satellites and hosted payloads from two Indian start-ups?
solution:
• DS-EO Mission launched on 30 June 2022 via PSLV-C53 from Sriharikota.
  • Carried DS-EO, NeuSAR, and SCOOB-1 satellites from Singapore.
  • Hosted six payloads on POEM (PSLV Orbital Experimental Module), including:
    • Digantara – ROBI (space radiation monitor)
    • Dhruva Space – DSOD-1U satellite deployer
  • First time ISRO used spent PS4 stage as a stabilized orbital platform.

question: Which satellite, launched in June 2022 aboard Ariane 5, was leased entirely to Tata Play for DTH services?
solution:
• GSAT-24, launched on 22 June 2022 by Arianespace’s Ariane 5 from French Guiana.
  • Built by ISRO for NSIL, India’s commercial space arm.
  • Entire capacity leased to Tata Play for DTH broadcasting.
  • Satellite weighs 4180 kg, operates in 24-Ku band, and has a 15-year mission life.

question: What are the names of the lander and rover used in ISRO’s Chandrayaan-3 lunar mission?
solution:
• Chandrayaan-3, launched on 14 July 2023, successfully landed near the Moon’s south pole on 23 August 2023.
  • The mission included:
    • Vikram – the lander, named after Dr. Vikram Sarabhai, father of India’s space programme.
    • Pragyan – the rover, meaning “wisdom” in Sanskrit.
  • The lander deployed the rover via a ramp, and both conducted in-situ experiments for 14 Earth days.
  • Key payloads included ChaSTE, ILSA, and LIBS, contributing to lunar surface analysis.
